definition: contrary/opposite/backwards/to go against/to oppose/to betray/to rebel
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
lit. navigating a boat against the current (idiom)/fig. in a tough environment (one needs to work hard)
study is like rowing upstream – if you don't keep pushing forward, you fall behind
pinyin: xue2 ru2 ni4 shui3 xing2 zhou1 , bu4 jin4 ze2 tui4
containing_words.word: 學如逆水行舟，不進則退

definition: like rowing a boat upstream, if you stop moving forward you fall back (idiom)
pinyin: ni4 shui3 xing2 zhou1 , bu4 jin4 ze2 tui4

sentences.english: The oarsman found that the he had to pull against the tide.
sentences.chinese: 划槳者發現他必須逆水划船。

sentences.english: It means that learning is like sailing upstream.
sentences.chinese: 意思就是說學習像在逆水中行船。

sentences.english: Water, I think you in against the current.
Time flows with the current, life sails against the current.
sentences.chinese: 時間順流而下，生活逆水行舟。

sentences.english: Life is boating against the current.
sentences.chinese: 生活是逆水行舟，不進則退。

sentences.english: When things are going well, celebrate.
You know swimming against the current is difficult.
sentences.chinese: 你知道的，逆水游泳很難。

sentences.english: How far upriver might Chinese manufacturing travel?
sentences.chinese: 中國的製造業打算逆水而上走多遠？

sentences.english: The man ( who is swimming against the stream) knows the strength of it.
sentences.chinese: 逆水游泳的人才知道潮流的力量。

sentences.english: You felt the floor, a pole slacken qianhe back.
sentences.chinese: 逆水行舟用力撐，一篙鬆勁退千尋。

definition: to sail against the current/(fig.) to go against the flow
against the stream/adverse current/a countercurrent/fig. reactionary tendency/to go against the trend
lit. navigating a boat against the current (idiom)/fig. in a tough environment (one needs to work hard)
to set sail/to brave the waves
under full sail/going as fast as possible
to scull (with a single oar, usually mounted on the stern of the boat)
